channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Hole in pavement, 8th October
item.description:
Hole in pavement, SW corner Leslie Road and High Road N2. Potential collapsed UKPN or Openreach manhole cover. Please investigate and liaise with respective utility as necessary to have fixed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 201, High Road, Finchley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Stolen cars being cleared of personal artifacts, 8th October
item.description:
Our estate car park is being used by car thieves who dump all the personal artifacts from the cars on to our car park. Today a baby seat & car manufacturer owner pack have been stuffed down the wall. The car in the photos is always around when this happens

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Navarino Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned works cover, 8th October
item.description:
Abandoned roadworks cover outside 138 High Road N2. Please remove or liaise with necessary utility to have removed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): High Road, Finchley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There are numerous broken, rocking and uneven pavers., 8th October
item.description:
This has been gradually getting worse and now presents a serious tripping hazard particularly to children and the elderly although I have seen able bodied adults stumble.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Luton Road, Albany Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 2 dumped lime bikes, 8th October
item.description:
2 dumped bikes in the public parkland

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Street, Finsbury, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Continuous dumping, 8th October
item.description:
Hello again as reported before, this is happening daily. I'm grateful that you clear these bags but they'll keep coming unless action is taken. Is it worth me reporting this every day or will you schedule a regular collection to oblige the offender(s)?

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Stoke Newington Church Street, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Reoccurring build up of leaves, 8th October
item.description:
A pile of leaves and broken branches/weeds seems to collect by a garage door belonging to someone on Towncourt Lane. This happens several times over autumn/winter. Unfortunately it appears that the wind blows them down Bushey Avenue and they spiral and gather at this point of the road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bushey Avenue, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sawdust, 8th October
item.description:
Tree been cut down but all the sawdust been left to just blow every where I suffer with COPD and I live directly across the road from this tree at 140 lensbury I’m retired and really need fresh air so I every morning I open patio door but this dust is affecting my breathing so I can’t have doors open all I want is the sawdust all cleaned up

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lensbury Way, Lessness Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Argyle Way, Bermondsey, London

item.title: Large mattress on the street for about a week now., 8th October

item.title: 2b Dyne Road, NW6, 8th October
item.description:
A pavement slab outside Mary Gee Hairdressing salon is lifted up and is trip hazard. I almost tripped on it yesterday and almost fell over - lucking I did not fall but had I fallen I would have sustained an injury. Please can this be fixed as soon as possible as it is a safety hazard. Also many of the pavements in the area are in a terrible and dangerous state. It would be good if a representative from Council visited the area to inspect the state of the pavements.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Dunster Gardens, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Staffordshire Street, Peckham, London

item.title: Building materials fly tipped, 8th October
item.description:
Hi, someone has fly tipped a load of building materials outside our flat. I reported it around 2 weeks ago and have requested updates but not heard anything back.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Gloucester Drive, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Big Pile of rubbish dumped outside in the street for weeks, blocking pavement, 8th October
item.description:
This big pile of rubbish including old carpets and furniture has been dumped on the pavement outside 69 Ravenscourt for weeks. Making it difficult for disabled/elderly/children to pass and looks like an eyesore.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 67, Ravenscourt Road, St Paul's Cray, London
